Imsak: â€œSeek help through patience and prayer.â€ (Alâ€‘Baqarah 2:45)
â€œRemember your Lord morning and evening.â€ (Alâ€‘Insan 76:25)
Fajr: â€œCelebrate His praise in the late hours of the night and at the ends of the day.â€ (Qaf 50:40)
Sunrise: â€œHe has subjected the sun and the moon for you.â€ (Ibrahim 14:33)
â€œHe is the One who causes the dawn to break.â€ (Alâ€‘Anâ€˜am 6:96)
Dhuhr: â€œEstablish prayer from the decline of the sun.â€ (Alâ€‘Isra 17:78)
â€œIndeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers at fixed times.â€ (Anâ€‘Nisa 4:103)
Asr: â€œBy time, indeed mankind is in loss.â€ (Alâ€‘Asr 103:1â€‘2)
â€œThey establish prayer and are patient.â€ (Alâ€‘Aâ€˜raf 7:170)
Maghrib: â€œEstablish prayer until the darkness of the night.â€ (Alâ€‘Isra 17:78)
â€œGlorify your Lord before the setting of the sun.â€ (Qaf 50:39)
Isha: â€œAnd in a part of the night prostrate yourself to Him.â€ (Alâ€‘Insan 76:26)
â€œStand for prayer at night, except for a little.â€ (Alâ€‘Muzzammil 73:2)

ramadanNotes: â€œO you who believe, fasting is prescribed for you as it was prescribed for those before you.â€ (Alâ€‘Baqarah 2:183)
